. The bust, about 3,400 years old, is at the top of a "wish list" of five major artifacts exhibited abroad that Egypt wants returned as part of its cultural heritage. Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that "this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people."
